title: "My Career Made, Then Unmade By Gandhis": Mani Shankar Aiyar's Big Claim - NDTV
summary:
My Career Made, Then Unmade By Gandhis: Mani Shankar Aiyar's Big Claim

Date: Not specified Source: Press Trust of India

Senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar has claimed that the Gandhi family played a significant role in both his political rise and subsequent marginalization within the party.

  • Aiyar stated, "The irony of my life is that my political career was made by the Gandhis and unmade by the Gandhis."
  • He expressed frustration over a lack of substantial engagement with key members of the Gandhi family over the years.
  • Aiyar mentioned he did not have the opportunity to meet Sonia Gandhi for a decade and had only limited interactions with Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi.
  • He recalled needing to ask Priyanka to convey birthday wishes to Rahul during a period of his suspension from the party.
  • Aiyar wrote a letter to Rahul Gandhi seeking clarity on his suspension but received no acknowledgment.
  • He reflected on the political environment in 2012 during crises for both Sonia Gandhi and former PM Manmohan Singh, noting Pranab Mukherjee's potential leadership during that time.
“For 10 years, I was not given an opportunity to meet Sonia Gandhi one-on-one. I was not given an opportunity, except once, of spending any meaningful time with Rahul Gandhi.”

This interview sheds light on the complex dynamics within the Congress party and highlights Aiyar's personal experiences regarding his political journey influenced by the Gandhi family.

title: Aaditya Thackeray's request to CM Devendra Fadnavis ahead of cabinet expansion - Hindustan Times
summary:
Aaditya Thackeray's request to CM Devendra Fadnavis ahead of cabinet expansion

Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray has urged Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis to initiate an inquiry into a road scam targeting former CM Eknath Shinde ahead of the state cabinet expansion.

  • Aaditya Thackeray calls for the exclusion of Eknath Shinde and two other former ministers from the cabinet.
  • Thackeray alleges involvement in a ₹12,000 crore road scam, emphasizing the need for accountability.
  • He highlights concerns over a controversial 400 KM road concretisation project by BMC.
  • The inquiry request comes just before a scheduled cabinet expansion in Maharashtra.
"If the BJP government is serious about acting on the road scam, they must keep the then illegal CM Shinde and 2 guardian ministers of Shinde’s regime- Lodha and Kesarkar, out of the cabinet." - Aaditya Thackeray

The situation around the alleged road scam continues to evolve, with increasing calls for transparency and an investigation, as the government prepares for new appointments in the upcoming cabinet expansion.

title: Delhi assembly polls: AAP's 4th list out, Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi assembly polls: AAP's 4th list out, Arvind Kejriwal to contest from New Delhi

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 03:42 PM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has released its fourth and final candidate list for the 2025 Delhi assembly elections, featuring Arvind Kejriwal and Chief Minister Atishi as key candidates in their respective constituencies.

  • Arvind Kejriwal will contest from New Delhi, while Atishi will field from Kalkaji.
  • The list includes 38 candidates, among them, Saurabh Bharadwaj, Gopal Rai, Satyendra Kumar Jain, and Durgesh Pathak.
  • Assembly elections for the 70-member Delhi assembly are scheduled for February 2025.
  • Kejriwal has ruled out any pre-poll alliance with the Congress, stating AAP will rely on its own strength.
  • Other notable candidates include Saurabh Bharadwaj from Greater Kailash and Gopal Rai from Babarpur.
"AAP's 10 years of misrule have brought Delhi to the brink of ruin." - Parvesh Sahib Singh, BJP candidate for New Delhi

This election is poised to be competitive, with Kejriwal likely to face sons of two former chief ministers, indicating a high-stakes battle for power in Delhi.

title: Arvind Kejriwal, Atishi On 4th AAP List For Delhi Polls - NDTV
'My political career made & unmade by the Gandhis': What senior Congress leader Mani Shankar Aiyar said o - The Times of India
Shiv Sena MLAs scramble for berths ahead of Maharashtra cabinet expansion today | What we know so far - Hindustan Times
summary:
Shiv Sena MLAs scramble for berths ahead of Maharashtra cabinet expansion today | What we know so far

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: HT News Desk

The swearing-in ceremony of the Maharashtra cabinet is set for Sunday evening, following intense discussions among the BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP after their recent electoral victory. The upcoming expansion will see Ministers vying for key positions amid strategic portfolio discussions.

  • The cabinet expansion, coming before the winter assembly session, is led by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.
  • The BJP is expected to receive 20-21 ministerial positions, with Shiv Sena and NCP obtaining 11-12 and 9-10, respectively.
  • Intense competition exists within the Shiv Sena, particularly among MLAs seeking ministerial roles.
  • Former ministers are struggling to secure positions, while certain controversial figures face opposition from the BJP.
  • Other political dynamics include complaints about certain MLAs' behavior and past controversies.
  • The Mahayuti coalition achieved a sweeping victory in the November assembly elections, securing 230 out of 288 seats.
“30-32 ministers are likely to take oath on Sunday, including 20 BJP leaders and the rest from Shiv Sena.”

The upcoming cabinet expansion is crucial for the Mahayuti government as it aims to solidify its position following a significant electoral victory and address internal party dynamics and public expectations.

title: UP: Aarti performed after 46 years at ancient temple in Sambhal | Video - Hindustan Times
summary:
UP: Aarti performed after 46 years at ancient temple in Sambhal | Video

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 11:36 AM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

Aarti was performed for the first time in 46 years at the ancient Bhasma Shankar temple in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh, after it was reopened by local authorities recently.

  • The temple was discovered during an anti-encroachment drive, where officials found it houses deities Lord Shiva and Hanuman.
  • This centuries-old temple had been closed since the 1978 communal riots.
  • Local authorities have initiated measures to restore the temple and ensure its security, including the installation of CCTV cameras.
  • Officials plan to hand over the temple to the community it originally belonged to and take action against encroachments.
"A Brahmin should be appointed here so that he can stay here. Till the time caretaker is appointed, we will take responsibility." - Acharya Brahm Shukla

The reopening of the temple marks a significant moment for the local community, rekindling spiritual practices that had been dormant for decades and promising to restore the temple to its original state.

title: "If I Dig Up Parliament, Find Something...": A Owaisi On Mosque Surveys - NDTV
Kolkata Woman Beheaded, Chopped Into 3 Pieces For Rejecting Brother-In-Law - NDTV
summary:
Kolkata Woman Beheaded, Chopped Into 3 Pieces For Rejecting Brother-In-Law

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A woman in her 30s in Kolkata was brutally murdered by her brother-in-law after she rejected his romantic advances. The victim's body was found chopped into three pieces and scattered in different locations.

  • The victim, a domestic helper, was strangled, beheaded, and dismembered by her brother-in-law.
  • The severed head was found in a polythene bag, leading to the discovery of the rest of the body parts.
  • The accused, Atiur Rahman Laskar, confessed to the crime, revealing that he was enraged by the victim's rejection.
  • Police investigations, including the use of sniffer dogs and CCTV footage, led to Laskar's arrest in his native village.
"The victim had started avoiding Laskar and even blocked his phone number. This rejection enraged him." - Deputy Commissioner of Police Bidisha Kalita

The brutal murder highlights the extreme consequences of unrequited love and the importance of timely intervention in cases of harassment and stalking.

title: 'Abusing power as CM': Karnataka BJP chief hits back at Siddaramaiah on corruption allegations - Hindustan Times
summary:
Abusing power as CM: Karnataka BJP chief hits back at Siddaramaiah on corruption allegations

Date: Dec 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Karnataka chief BY Vijayendra has responded to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who alleged Vijayendra's involvement in a corruption case and called for a CBI investigation.

  • Siddaramaiah accused Vijayendra of attempting to bribe Anwar Manippady with ₹150 crore to suppress investigations.
  • The CM demanded a CBI inquiry into the allegations against the BJP leader.
  • Vijayendra questioned Siddaramaiah's moral authority to demand an investigation given his own corruption allegations.
  • The BJP leader criticized Siddaramaiah for his handling of previous CBI and ED investigations.
  • Siddaramaiah claimed that BJP has turned Karnataka into its "ATM."
"What morality do you have to order a CBI investigation into someone else, humiliated by the High Court verdict?" - BY Vijayendra

This heated exchange highlights the ongoing political tussle in Karnataka, with both parties hurling allegations of corruption at each other as the call for an independent investigation gains momentum.

title: Bengaluru cop dies by suicide alleging harassment by wife, father-in-law - The Indian Express
summary:
Bengaluru cop dies by suicide alleging harassment by wife, father-in-law

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: The Indian Express

A police head constable in Bengaluru died by suicide on Friday night, alleging harassment by his wife and father-in-law. This tragic incident raises concerns about domestic issues leading to severe outcomes.

  • The deceased, Thippanna Alugur, was a head constable at the Hulimavu police station.
  • Alugur left a death note accusing his wife, Parvathi, and her father, Yamunappa, of harassment.
  • The incident follows another recent suicide case involving harassment in Bengaluru.
  • A heated argument reportedly occurred before his death, which involved abusive communication from Yamunappa.
  • Alugur's mother has lodged a complaint leading to legal action against his wife and father-in-law.
“Yamunappa had asked him to die or else he would ‘finish him off.’”

This case highlights the serious implications of domestic abuse and the urgent need for support systems for individuals facing such stress. Mental health and social welfare interventions are crucial in preventing similar tragedies in the future.

title: Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion Today, New Faces Expected | List Of Probables - News18
summary:
Maharashtra Cabinet Expansion Today, New Faces Expected | List Of Probables

Date: December 15, 2024

Source: News18

The cabinet expansion of the BJP-led Maharashtra government is set to occur today, with several new faces expected to join the council of ministers as the state prepares for its upcoming Winter Session.

  • 20 to 22 BJP MLAs and 10 to 12 Shiv Sena MLAs are expected to be sworn in today.
  • 10 leaders from Ajit Pawar’s NCP are also likely to take oath.
  • The Mahayuti alliance may drop underperforming ministers from both BJP and Shiv Sena.
  • Key probable ministers for BJP include Nitesh Rane and Pankaja Munde, among others.
  • Ajit Pawar is anticipated to retain the Finance portfolio, while the Home Ministry may go to BJP.
  • The cabinet expansion comes one day before the Winter Session of the Assembly starting December 16.
“The Mahayuti may drop underperforming ministers, which could include 4 leaders from the Shinde camp, 3 from the BJP, and 2 from the Ajit Pawar faction,” sources said.

The cabinet expansion indicates a strategic move to solidify the government ahead of the Winter Session, emphasizing the coalition's ability to refresh its ministerial lineup with new talent while retaining essential portfolios.

title: Karnataka government announces SWIFT city in Bengaluru. All you need to know - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karnataka government announces SWIFT city in Bengaluru

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 10:16 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

The Karnataka government has announced plans to develop a SWIFT (Startups, Workspaces, Innovation, Finance, and Technology) city near Bengaluru’s Sarjapur, aiming to enhance the start-up ecosystem and become a major industrial hub.

  • SWIFT city will cover 1,000 acres, in proximity to key IT hubs with excellent connectivity to NH 44 and NH 48.
  • It will feature 8 to 10 Plug-and-Play facilities, each 20–25 acres.
  • The city will include 150m wide connecting roads, state-of-the-art offices, co-working spaces, residential blocks, and schools.
  • Land parcels of 5,000 to 20,000 sq. ft. will be available for startups through lease, sale, or equity-sharing models.
“SWIFT city will be another landmark industrial hub in Karnataka, similar to ITPL and Electronic City. It will be built in more than 1000 acres near Sarjapur and become a new start-up hotspot of the city.” - MB Patil

The Karnataka government also plans to create 5 Mini KWIN Cities across the state, aiming to replicate Bengaluru's success and promote equal growth. Further details will be shared at the upcoming Invest Karnataka summit.

title: Delhi's minimum temperature 4.9 degrees C; air quality 'poor' - Moneycontrol
Varun Dhawan asks Amit Shah difference between Ram and Ravan. Here's what he said - Hindustan Times
summary:
Varun Dhawan asks Amit Shah difference between Ram and Ravan. Here's what he said

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Union home minister Amit Shah explained to actor Varun Dhawan the key differences between Lord Ram and Ravan during an engaging conversation at the Agenda Aaj Tak event.

  • Varun Dhawan inquired about the fundamental difference between Ram and Ravan.
  • Amit Shah articulated that Ram's life was guided by his dharma, while Ravan reshaped his duties based on personal interests.
  • Dhawan likened Shah to Hanuman, praising his selfless service to the nation.
  • The dialogue also touched on themes of arrogance, with Shah noting that Ravan was arrogant in his knowledge, unlike Ram.
“Some people determine their interests by their dharma (duties)…Ram's life was based on his dharma, while Ravan tried to alter his duties as per his own definitions and thoughts.” - Amit Shah

In conclusion, the interaction highlighted important moral and philosophical distinctions drawn from the Ramayana, showcasing a blend of mythology with modern public discourse.

Bengaluru techie suicide case: Nikita Singhania, her mother and brother arrested, produced in court - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru techie suicide case: Nikita Singhania, her mother and brother arrested, produced in court

Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Bengaluru Police have arrested Nikita Singhania, her mother, and her brother in connection with the suicide of Atul Subash, who alleged harassment and extortion in his suicide note.

  • Nikita Singhania and her family members were arrested for abetment of suicide.
  • They were apprehended from Gurugram and Prayagraj respectively and have been placed in judicial custody.
  • The police investigation revealed monetary demands from the family that contributed to Subash's emotional distress.
  • Atul Subash was found dead on December 9, leaving a note accusing his wife of continuous harassment.
  • His suicide note was shared widely, causing national outrage and prompting police action.
"Justice is due," read a placard hung by Subash in his home before his death.

The case highlights serious issues surrounding domestic disputes and mental health, with police emphasizing the need for justice.

title: Bengaluru techie suicide: Subhash Atul's estranged wife Nikita Singhania, her brother and mother arrested - The Times of India
Yogi Adityanath on the impeachment notices against Allahabad HC judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav and Jagdeep Dhankhar - The Hindu
summary:
Yogi Adityanath on the impeachment notices against Allahabad HC judge Shekhar Kumar Yadav and Jagdeep Dhankhar

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath criticized the Opposition for initiating impeachment notices against Rajya Sabha Chairman Jagdeep Dhankhar and Allahabad High Court's Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav, asserting that truth-tellers face threats of impeachment.

  • Adityanath spoke at the World Hindu Economic Forum on December 14, 2024.
  • He accused the Congress party of double standards and attempting to suppress the truth.
  • He advocated for a Uniform Civil Code, emphasizing respect for the majority community's sentiments.
  • The BJP leader remarked on the Opposition's concerns about his rise from a farmer's son to his current position.
  • He stated that India's economy is on track to become the third largest by 2027.
"Whoever speaks the truth, these people will pressurise him with impeachment (motions), and still they talk about the Constitution. Look at their double standards." - Yogi Adityanath

Adityanath emphasized that the Sanatan religion promotes inclusivity without claiming superiority, affirming its historical significance and contribution to India's legacy.

One Nation, One Election: Bill provisions show simultaneous polls not until 2034 - Hindustan Times
summary:
One Nation, One Election: Bill provisions show simultaneous polls not until 2034

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 08:36 AM IST

Source: Hindustan Times

The Constitutional Amendment Bill for "One Nation, One Election" aims to synchronize the terms of the Lok Sabha and state assemblies, but actual simultaneous voting will not begin until 2034.

  • The bill proposes new articles to allow synchronization of terms for both Lok Sabha and state assemblies.
  • Should a legislature dissolve early, mid-term elections will only be for the remaining term of that specific legislature.
  • The amendments include adding Article 82(A) and modifying Articles 83, 172, and 327.
  • The provisions will take effect from an "appointed date" as determined by the President after the next general election in 2029.
  • It establishes that legislative assemblies elected after the appointed date will end with the tenure of the Lok Sabha.
  • A second bill will align elections in Union Territories with the synchronizations.
“Notwithstanding anything in Article 83 and Article 172, the term of all legislative assemblies constituted in any general election held after the appointed date and before the expiry of the full term of the House of the People shall come to an end on the expiry of the full term of the House of the People.”

The introduction of this bill marks a significant move towards potential electoral reform in India, with critics raising concerns about its implications for democracy.

title: ‘Whoever speaks truth…’: Adityanath backs VP Dhankhar, HC judge - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Whoever speaks truth…’: Adityanath backs VP Dhankhar, HC judge

Publication Date: Dec 15, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed support for Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar and an Allahabad High Court judge, criticizing the impeachment motions brought against them and claiming that those who speak the truth face threats of impeachment.

  • Adityanath stated that those who “speak the truth” in India are threatened with impeachment.
  • The comments were made in context of impeachment motions against VP Dhankhar and Justice Shekhar Yadav.
  • He emphasized the need for a Uniform Civil Code in India, defending Judge Yadav's opinion on the matter.
  • Adityanath spoke at the World Hindu Economic Forum in Mumbai, accentuating the opposition's perceived threat to truth-tellers.
  • He accused the Congress party of “strangulating” the Constitution historically.
“Whoever speaks the truth, these people will pressurise him with impeachment, and still they talk about the Constitution.” - Yogi Adityanath

Adityanath's remarks highlight the ongoing tension between the government and opposition parties regarding allegations of political motivations behind impeachment motions, suggesting a call for a more respectful discourse surrounding truth and governance in India.

title: 'Nehru Model Failed, We're Trying To Correct It Since 2014': S Jaishankar - NDTV
summary:
Nehru Model Failed, We're Trying To Correct It Since 2014: S Jaishankar

Publication Date: November 7, 2024

Source: NDTV

In a recent address, External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar discussed the failures of the 'Nehru development model' and the ongoing efforts to correct its consequences since 2014.

  • Jaishankar stated that both Russia and China reject the economic assumptions of the Nehru era.
  • The 'Nehru development model' has influenced India's politics, bureaucracy, and education.
  • He emphasized a strong need for a course correction post-2014, but acknowledged this task remains challenging.
  • Jaishankar quoted John Foster Dulles on India's independence to highlight past geopolitical misconceptions.
  • He pointed out a national consensus on the model's failure but noted a reluctance to explore alternatives.
  • The current environment requires more focus on resiliency, reliability, and trust rather than just openness.
"As a result, we end up doing the reforms we must, rarely the reforms we should." - S. Jaishankar

Jaishankar concluded that the idea of 'Atmanirbharta' should be about self-reliance without equating to protectionism, emphasizing the importance of national security and thoughtful action.

Sambhal officials reopen ancient temple closed since riots in 1978 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sambhal officials reopen ancient temple closed since riots in 1978

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Sambhal district officials have reopened the Bhasma Shankar temple, which had been closed since the communal riots of 1978. This reopening is a significant moment for the local Hindu community after decades of displacement.

  • The temple was discovered during an anti-encroachment drive near Shahi Jama Masjid.
  • A Hanuman idol and a Shivling were found during the inspection.
  • Sub-Divisional Magistrate Vandana Misra highlighted the discovery and the decision to reopen the temple.
  • Local residents, including Mukesh Rastogi, claim the temple is over 500 years old and has significant historical importance.
  • The reopening follows recent violence related to a survey of the Shahi Jama Masjid.
"We all came here together and decided to reopen the temple," - Vandana Misra, Sub-Divisional Magistrate.

The reopening of the Bhasma Shankar temple marks a restorative step for the community, allowing local residents to reconnect with a significant part of their heritage that had been inaccessible for decades.
